vehicles.description: A yellow van is parked on the right side of the road, facing away from this vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: The parked truck on the side of the road has reduced the usable width of this lane and it may start moving.

vehicles.description: A dark-colored sedan is parked on the left side of the road, facing our car.
vehicles.explanation: Parked vehicles reduce the drivable space on the road and may conceal potential hazards, such as opening doors or pedestrians suddenly stepping out.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A pedestrian stands beside a sedan parked on the right side of the road, possibly preparing to cross the street or perhaps distracted.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrians may enter the roadway, requiring self-driving vehicles to slow down or stop to yield.

barriers.description: On the right side of the road, there are temporary barriers set up, with piles of garbage beside them.
barriers.explanation: These obstacles and debris determine the usage of the lanes and may obstruct the view of pedestrians or animals, presenting the risk of unexpected obstructions on the road.

barriers.description: To the left, a low concrete barrier extends along the road, restricting lateral movement.
barriers.explanation: These may have delineated the boundaries between private or building property rights and roads, ensuring that self-driving cars always travel within the correct road boundaries.

other objects.description: On the right side of the road, near temporary obstacles and beside pedestrians, piles of trash are scattered.
other objects.explanation: Trash by the roadside, if scattered onto the road by animals or the wind, may become a signal of a sudden obstacle.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image observed, there are several features of note.

There are two parked vehicles. The first is a yellow van on the right side of the road, facing away from the vehicle. Its presence has reduced the available driving space in the lane, creating a potential hazard if it starts moving. Secondly, a dark-colored sedan is positioned on the left side of the road, facing the direction of our vehicle. This sedan reduces the available road space and may conceal potential dangers such as individuals stepping out from behind it or doors suddenly being opened.

A pedestrian is also present in the scene, standing beside the sedan on the right side of the road. It is unclear if they intend to cross the street or if they are simply distracted, but either way, they may enter the roadway and necessitate cautious driving behavior, including possibly slowing down or stopping.

In addition, there are barriers at the roadside. Specifically, there are temporary barriers with adjacent piles of garbage to the right, which limit lane usage and could obscure the view of further hazards such as pedestrians or animals, leading to sudden obstructions. On the left, a low concrete barrier runs along the roadside, effectively demarcating the limits of the road and private properties, ensuring the autonomous vehicle remains within the appropriate driving zone.

Lastly, on the right and near the temporary barriers, there are piles of trash. The scattered trash presents the possibility of becoming an unforeseen obstacle on the road if displaced by animals or wind.

The image lacks traffic signs, traffic lights, and traffic cones.

driving_suggestion: Drive carefully and maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead. Be prepared to stop or slow down if pedestrians attempt to cross the road. Watch for any parked vans on the right that might start moving. Due to wet road conditions and potential debris, slow down to increase reaction time and ensure safety. Keep a safe distance from parked cars and debris on the right to avoid potential dangers. Monitor the yellow van for any sudden changes in trajectory and be ready to give way if necessary. If there is a safe distance to pass, proceed cautiously, checking for obstacles on the left. Given the presence of stationary vehicles, pedestrians approaching the road, traffic cones, and parked cars, the vehicle should slow down and prepare to stop or navigate around unexpected obstacles. The vehicle should maintain a safe distance from the yellow van and be alert for any signals of intent from pedestrians or the van. Additionally, the vehicle should monitor any potential hazards from garbage piled by the roadside entering the road. The wet road conditions mean that the vehicle should increase stopping distance and slow down.

1.description and explanation: The item appears to be a pile of debris on the side of the road. It consists of various discarded materials, which could potentially include trash, construction materials, or other waste items that are not appropriately disposed of. The presence of such debris could indicate an area undergoing construction or neglect. The debris could influence the future driving behavior of the ego car by narrowing the usable width of the road, leading to the need for cautious driving to avoid any materials that might extend onto the roadway. Additionally, if the debris spills into the road, it may pose a hazard that requires drivers to swerve or stop to avoid a collision.

2.description and explanation: This is a pile of debris positioned on the road, appearing to contain various materials such as plastic sheets and construction remnants. The presence of this debris on the driving path necessitates that the driver of the ego car carefully navigates around it to avoid any potential damage to the vehicle and maintain safety. Extra caution might be required as navigating around the debris could bring the car closer to the oncoming traffic lane.
